data.title: ARRAKIS tileset cleanup
data.body: Some more maintenance to make mapping more comfortable. This stiches some big unique and easy to identify terrain tiles together that are scattered all over the R8 file for unknown reasons. There may be more to do especially in the category "Unidentified". However it is really annoying work because of the redundancy across tilesets and extremely similar look of the individual tiles. I am done. Will be the last change for now.

data.title: OpenRA.Utility : export a SHP to a horizontal SpriteSheet PNG
data.body:
Currently it's possible to convert a SHP to many PNG files with this command:

```
--png SHPFILE PALETTE [--noshadow]    
```

And the following command can convert a single PNG with multiple frames appended after another to a single SHP :

```
--shp PNGFILE FRAMEWIDTH 
```

The problem is, once you have typed the first command, you have many PNG files that you have to merge, appending them all in one large horizontal PNG file (with The Gimp or Photoshop). And if you have many PNG files, it can be a long task and a real pain to do.

It would be **really** useful for mod authors if the OpenRA.Utility (and later, the Asset Browser) could generate a horizontal SpriteSheet PNG file with a command like this one:

```
--spritesheetpng SHPFILE PALETTE [--noshadow]   
```

or 

```
--horizontalpng SHPFILE PALETTE [--noshadow]   
```

data.title: Permit black color
data.body:
When I'm trying to pick the color, it's able to pick only dark-red, dark-green or dark-etc, but not black.

So I have to edit "~/.openra/settings.yml" file to pick the black color.

data.title: Install from CD freeze (CNC)
data.body:
As the title says, my CNC install freezes during extraction (ISO, not physical CD). It extracts conquer.mix, then stops there. When I cancel and reopen, the game crashes.

Here's a log, although I really doubt if it will help: http://pastebin.com/gKd0nuLv

From what little I can tell, it seems to miss a file (speech.mix) which never actually extracted because of the freeze... deleting conquer.mix fixes the crash. Because of this I can only get the mod running via download. (EDIT: I could still install the music from the playlist, thankfully.)

The other mods (RA, D2K) are able to extract correctly, by the way.

data.title: System.Net.Sockets.SocketException: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host
data.body:
Crash and hang on both realease and playtest versions, when playing against bots

```
Red Alert Mod at Version playtest-20131220
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5472
Exception of type `System.IO.IOException`: Unable to write data to the transport connection: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host.
Inner Exception of type `System.Net.Sockets.SocketException`: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host
     at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Send(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size, SocketFlags socketFlags)
   at System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream.Write(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size)
   at System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream.Write(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size)
   at System.IO.MemoryStream.WriteTo(Stream stream)
   at OpenRA.Network.NetworkConnection.Send(Byte[] packet)
   at OpenRA.Network.EchoConnection.Send(Int32 frame, List`1 orders)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.Send(Int32 frame, List`1 orders)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.TickInner(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: Added the Dune 2000 BLOXXMAS terrain tiles
data.body: Only the ones of interest. See http://d2kplus.com/wiki/index.php?title=Tile_Sets#Similarities. Part of the original 1.06 patch I promised to do for the christmas release. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4296#issuecomment-30542430 Better late then never I guess.

data.title: Fixed/precised some descriptions of #4415
data.body: Follow-up on #4415.

data.title: Suggestion: split system.yaml into multiple files
data.body:
One of the arguments for removing the runtime mod merging was that files of the shipping mods could be referenced to via mod.yaml.

However, system.yaml is a file any larger mod will have to edit (to make AI use new units, for example), so any engine change that adds some trait under Player: or World: that would crash the game if missing makes life harder for modders when updating the engine.

My suggestion would be to put all engine stuff that just needs to be there but doesn't provide any changeable stuff to modders (Player: -> GpsWatcher, World: -> ActorMap etc.) in one file, and everything that modders might want to edit (production queue settings, HackyAI settings, resource settings, Crate settings etc.) into one or more separate file(s).

This may be less convenient for the devs, but would make life much easier for modders as they could always reference the RA system.yaml (maybe it could even be moved under 'common') with all the required engine stuff and only have to update their own yaml(s) with AI and resource stuff if there have been significant changes/additions to these particular parts of the engine.

data.title: Fixed transparency glitches in the sniper icon.
data.body: #3254 is best spotted in the asset browser.

data.title: Un-hardcoded several HackyAI aspects
data.body:
This un-hardcodes things like the excess power factor and its minimum, as well as some radiuses and a count limit.

Quite a few modding veterans like to fiddle with those settings themselves rather than being forced to live with hard-coded values.

data.title: Display shroud by default again in Dune 2000
data.body: As discussed in IRC. It looks cool now so show it by default again as in all the other mods.

data.title: Removed the build radius restrictions for Dune 2000
data.body: It is controversial #4378 and unnecessary for this mod because of the terrain. All clumsy designed ARRAKIS maps that required it have been removed already.

data.title: Update AUTHORS
data.body: Since nobody did it (weepings..), I propose to add my nickname.

data.title: Randomized sand and rock for Dune 2000
data.body: Followup of #4394. Contains a lot tileset cleanups. I had to work with the horrible WinForms editor so I stumpled upon crashes and problems I had to workaround while #3377 is not ready for editing. The pain was worth it however: ARRAKIS maps now look a lot better with randomized tiles and future maps will have auto-randomization.

data.title: Verified in-game names.
data.body:
Ok so what if you could log-into openRA with an account to have your username verified. (Indicated by a gold star infront if your name, you can't change your name while in this state and no other verified users can have the same name.) This way we don't have people running around stealing others name's.

We can still allow people to play account free just like now, but with logging in as an option.

This would also allow stat-tracking and even a ladder!

Now the main issue is deciding where people should make an account to use in openRA. Should we have our own custom server, or just use GetHUB accounts? 

Pros and cons of each need to be analyzed. 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1371038-verified-in-game-names?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remove "hide build-list" -feature when clicking same build-type icon again?
data.body:
This happens at least in RA mod (and Dune 2000 mod).

When you have for example tanks build-list open, and you click the tank build-list icon again, it will hide the whole building list.

Could this hiding be handled differently? I often press it accidentally, mostly due to lag.

And sometimes the building list is closed at the beginning of the game for some reason, maybe related to that.

data.title: Added OnCapture lua trigger and begun work on nod03a
data.body:
Most of everything is working just fine :) The mission needs some testing by persons other than myself and i would like feedback on my lua script which im sure won't be perfect.

Changes from the original:
- Removed harv that was sitting in GDI base not needed since one is supplied by Refinery in OpenRA
- Moved humvee above player base further north so that it is not instantly seen by the player
- Scripted some basic attack waves based on my experience playing the mission in c&c 1.06r3 earlier today
- Reduced the amount of starting units available to the player for difficulty reasons
- This mission has one cell trigger point which was not scripted due to lack of support

data.title: Made torpedos not travel through land, but destroy bridges
data.body: as this is legacy RA95 behavior I would like to see here for consistency and balancing reasons. #2097 Allies have many ways to destroy long bridges with ships. I cleaned up the hard-coded target code (Water == Water, Ground == !Water)  which gets rid of unwanted inconsistencies like flak truck and rocket troopers being unable to target water and bridges just because they defined `ValidTargets: Air, Ground` although no `InvalidTargets` were set and torpedos travelling through land when the target was missed #3252 which was not catched by just making the target cursor invalid.

data.title: Build units trigger
data.body:
As discuss in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4402 we may want an equivalent to the `Create team` trigger whose name is misleading. It meant build a unit ignoring prerequisites and owner in the original games.

Reference: http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Red_Alert_Single_Player_Mission_Creation_Guide

data.title: Add the map name to downloaded maps filenames?
data.body:
There are bunch of checksum filenames in the maps folder "Support\maps\ra".

It would be easier to delete some duplicate maps (old versions basically) if i saw the name of the map on front of the checksum.

Example: now there are files such as:
"fca283c3b2752403045ca397a9f560000594b277.oramap"

Would be easier if it looked like:
"All_that_Glitters_(fca283c3b2752403045ca 397a9f560000594b277).oramap"

Also it would be much easier to open those in the map editor as well.

Edit: added space to the checksum to prevent it from getting linked here.

data.title: OpenRA next stable release milestones?
data.body:
Do we have a set of milestones in place that should be met before the next stable release happens? I feel like right now where just kind of meandering around adding in things at random. 

I'm not trying to discourage people from coming along and randomly adding in some feature, just saying maybe we should have several things to put our focus on. 

Maybe even some things to try out in our various playtests that aren't likely to make it into the release but might be interesting to try? Balance changes that seem crazy but plausible for example; making the badger bomber a buildable unit for the soviets.

data.title: Added a DisplayDebugMessages setting and checkbox
data.body: Not sure if everyone cares for in-game messages like `Debug: Order lag is now 3 frames.` Now you can turn it off by unticking a checkbox. We might be already at a state where this can be the default.

data.title: Added the 3rd GDI mission
data.body: http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Destroy_The_SAM_Sites remade in Lua. Added the original lines from mission.ini to the map.yaml description this time.

data.title: Cell triggers
data.body: As discussed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4397 and IRC: we want cell triggers (implemented as `ICrushable`) exposed to Lua. Maybe some kind of automated code generation for the legacy triggers found in the INI.

data.title: Recreated the second GDI mission in Lua
data.body: First experiments with the `team.lua`. No really notable changes from the original. The enemy harvester does start with full health, but the army you amass will get it down fast, too. I don't use all waypoints yet, which makes the attacks a little random.
